text: Have you heard of transhumanism? If not, we believe that you should have. For us, transhumanism is of the utmost importance to the evolution of humanity and the continual growth of the human race due to the present, near future and long-term threats that society is facing. Transhumanism will be the key to our survival and we all need to get on board before it's too late. We're going to convince you today on why transhumanism is our last hope. Transhumanism has infinite possibilities, scientists have been creating bionic arms genetically-empreaged animals and have even suggested the idea of digital immortality. What is digital immortality? Digital immortality is the reconstruction of a personality in digital form. It is evident that people want to live ever, although it has never been considered a realistic option. It has always made this subject of fiction. With improved technology, it has become more probable. The Allen Institute in Seattle finished the recreation of a nice brain on a computer in May 2020. This brain computer can react to images and is the largest brain recreation on a computer to date. Life not, another organization working on digital immortality, is offered a service where you fill out a mind flow online and upload facts and images about yourself. It collects all your data and stores it. So when the technology is created, they will be able to download this data into a computer, robot or new human form. We ask, will this ever happen? Although there hasn't been much progress to date in the on-aspect of digital immortality, history has taught us that technology always improves. Stephen will talk about limb replacements. The use of limb replacements have been around since one time in BC. We know this as a word another toe was found from ancient Egypt. This gives us hope that in the future, the technology will improve and will be able to create digital immortality. Its digital immortality are last hope. This directly species only survive for approximately 1 to 10 million years, which may seem like the long time that in the existence of earth it is quite small. It is reasonable to presume humans will not be on the planet forever. This new technology may change that. Potentially, offloaded brains could last forever. The main uncertainty about digital immortality is whether the offloaded brain will be you. Will it be able to think and cause a robot or computer to talk and move? Or will it be simply a copy of your brain? The island institute ambition is to create a digital brain where after you die, it simply feels like you are waking up from surgery. This will lead to a huge debate on the moral aspect of digital immortality. People will be cautious about digital brains as they could lead to a dystopian society. Although if these digital brains act as currently imagined, they could create a society with no loss and grief. Transhumanism is the enhancement of the human experiences or human bodies with technology. VU token discusses how virtual reality is a stepping zone mentally to physical transhumanism. They discuss that when you are experiencing virtual reality in some cases you take on the shape of an avatar. This is a key stepping zone as a pair of people for a future where your body may be transhuman. It mentally prepares you for taking on a different form but still acting the same. They argue that people who have interacted with VR may be more open minded. Bostron discusses the negative effects of virtual reality. He states that eyes tell the brain it is moving but the ears tell the brain that the head is stationary which can cause dizziness, headaches and sometimes even nausea. If this problem is solved it could open a wide range of future activities that could be done with VR. One of the main uses would be medical training. Last year 97 people in Ireland donated their bodies to medical science. If we consider the number of medical students that need to know the structure of a human body 97 does not seem that a lot. It does not give every student an opportunity to fully dissect a body. If they can create a virtual body with the use of virtual reality all students could fully dissect and understand the human body. Covid has shown the importance of VR and opportunity in a socially distant future world. The British Psychological Society discusses how psychologists have started using VR. People can interact and feel like they are standing beside someone from the safety of their own home. This will boost their social engagement and will stop people from feeling as oscillation and alone. It is evident that virtual reality will be used in medical training in the future. It will also be used in situations where people cannot be physically near each other. There is no denying that a war or a disease similar to Covid could happen again so therefore virtual reality is highly important for the continuous growth of the human race. Virtual reality provides huge opportunities in medical and social interactions where physical contact is not possible. Companies tend to overuse AI as a buzzword for selling their smartphones, smart TVs or even smart fridges. They do this in order to make people think that the technology in their product is more advanced than it actually is. In reality, almost what they do is throw a few algorithms in there and slap the word AI on the packaging. But when I talk about artificial intelligence, I am talking about machines that can learn from themselves and improve with time and practice. This is called machine learning. The way AI learns is by continuously repeating the same task over and over again and learning from its mistakes each time. This is the type of technology that threatens humanity on an existential level. You see with each and every advancement in computer technology, AI gets faster at learning as it has access to more computing power which allows it to be able to do more tasks at the same time and do them at a faster rate. Hence, every year AI is getting smarter and it needs to be regulated or else we'll have a serious problem on our hands. The problem with AI is that once you let it out of the box, you can't put it back in. Once it's able to learn by itself, to think for itself and execute tasks by itself, it no longer needs to listen to what humans tell it to do. Including turn off. If it has access to an entire computer, then well it can just disable the off switch. You may think that this all sounds like science fiction that will take many years to become reality. However, the likes of Google, Microsoft and Amazon are already using machine learning to create incredibly complex algorithms and the intelligence of their AI is getting exponentially smarter every year. Open AI is an artificial intelligence research laboratory that has developed an AI called GPT-3 that has become the most powerful language model ever created. It can generate amazing human like text on demand. Bright articles about any topic and it can even have a conversation like a human in text form. Open AI opensource a lot of their AI tools, but they felt that this one was too dangerous to release to the public. So right now it's in a closed beta as it could be used maliciously to create fake news articles or incredibly intelligent bots that can be used to take advantage of people. This shows that AI is already getting to the point where it's able to understand language almost at the same level as humans. Now you may ask, what can we do then to prevent AI from becoming more advanced than us and taking over? Well, in my opinion there's only one option, transhumanism. We cannot have the AI becoming more advanced than us because then we've lost. So in order to keep up with the rate of progress of AI, we must merge with it. By combining the brain and the computer there are infinite possibilities for us. With the help of computers, we can stay on the same level as AI or even above it and work alongside it to create a better society while stopping a crisis on an existential scale from occurring. As an experiment, I gave OpenAI's GPT-3 the title for this TEDx presentation to see what it would write. So I gave it the line transhumanism is humanity's last hope and this is why we must and then the AI filled in the rest and it wrote and this is why we must spread the message to the world. Humanity's hope rests in the fusion of human mind with technology. This is not some far-fetched concept or idea, it is scientific reality, it is happening now, you can see it with your own eyes, the key is to spread the word and help others understand the importance of transhumanism. The future of humanity depends on it. It's quite incredible that AI wrote this itself and it really shows how intelligent AI is becoming. It also gives us a glimpse at how much of a threat to humanity this technology could be in the future. Transhumanism offers huge benefits to humanity in the medical field. It can be seen as humanity's last hope in terms of medicine and we're going to convince you on why that's the case. One significant benefit is that of artificial limb replacement, the thought of giving someone an arm or a leg when they cannot walk previously amazes me. I imagine a world where the fear of losing a limb is all but extinguished. The idea has been implemented to a man who lost his leg in a climbing accident. After many hours of research and trial and error, a group of scientists were able to manufacture a mechanical leg that connected to the subject's nervous system. He was able to operate the leg with little effort and praised it saying that it felt like it was a part of him. This is one of the more advanced artificial limbs and this span is transhuman. Wide a scale, we see transhumanism being implemented in events such as the Paralympics. These prosthetic legs are shown to be an improvement of that of the normal outdated leg and most of us are familiar with. They're an improvement because you can move the prosthetic legs faster because they weigh less than human legs. The need for transhuman mechanical arms or hands are also in demand today. People who've been unfortunate enough to lose their arm or to be worn without one can find hope in using both arms. This is thanks to the transhuman prosthetic limb replacement advances that we see improvement in a lot of the time. People need both arms for a range of tasks that include eating, driving or playing an instrument. With transhumanism improving every day, it could be possible that prosthetic limbs could be more common, similar to that of someone's smartphone nowadays. Sunday, in the future, a person may choose to replace their normal limb with that of an updated and upgraded one in order to improve their standard of living. A prosthetic limb might be more efficient for a person's lifestyle or work life with the abilities on how you can customize your transhuman limbs in the future. It could also be the key to our survival to have improved limbs. Some humans are born with organs and other insides that aren't always sufficient in keeping us alive. The chances of our organs shutting down are becoming less efficient when we get older increases and we need to wait in line in order to get a hard transplant for example. Sometimes this transplant doesn't go quick enough and we die. Other times this organ does come in time and we can still face organ rejection and still die. With transhumanism, we are hoping that we can solve this issue that humanity faces by making artificial organs that we can replace deficient now. To be able to do this, we would save many lives by not having to wait in line for someone else's organ that we need to survive. This would bring more hope to humanity as our chances of survival with deficient body parts will increase significantly. If this works out, we can push even further by improving the current healthy organs with improved ones. We can increase the stamina of a person and could hold our breath for longer. We go for a far longer without needing food or drink. If we can improve our organs without artificial ones and mass produce them, this could solve many issues we will face in the future. With climate change on the horizon, when the improved lungs and orders to survive, this could lead to humanity being able to take advantage of opportunities that otherwise would have been impossible. I have been situations where a surgeon might not be around or available to help you through a tough operation or surgery. This could be the cause of many deaths over the years, but with transhumanism, the doctor could be anywhere on the planet and still operate on you. This could be done if a doctor connects their nervous system to a computer and could operate mechanical arms in another location, anywhere on the planet, just if they've used their regular arms. This technology could also be the answer to doctors working on patients who have a highly contagious disease that could be lethal to a doctor if he or she were to continue. We could then help our nurses with mechanical breathing systems in the future that could help filter out any abnormal gases that the system doesn't recognize. This would be an upgrade to how our body defends against horrible diseases. This could lead to far more contained breakouts of diseases and could one day stop a potential blood pandemic from leaving a room. Obviously, as we are talking about transhumanism, which is rather ostensibly a human concept, all of our previous points and topics which we have talked about are inextricably linked to the human condition and therefore to each other. I would now delve into the military aspect of transhumanism, which is, unfortunately, in my opinion, inevitable. Immediately, upon even the mention of the topic of human enhancement and how it relates to warfare, a moral dilemma springs up inside me. Since the 1960s in America, jokes such as amphetamine have been used in the US military, so as to enhance physical alertness and physical endurance. 60 years ago, militaries were able to alter their soldiers in a way that was only beneficial to the cause these soldiers were hooding for. The argument can be made that shame. These are only physical attributes and these soldiers are still humans, but 60 years is a long time ago.

We cannot have the AI becoming more advanced than us because then we've lost. So in order to keep up with the rate of progress of AI, we must merge with it. By combining the brain and the computer there are infinite possibilities for us. With the help of computers, we can stay on the same level as AI or even above it and work alongside it to create a better society while stopping a crisis on an existential scale from occurring. As an experiment, I gave OpenAI's GPT-3 the title for this TEDx presentation to see what it would write. So I gave it the line transhumanism is humanity's last hope and this is why we must and then the AI filled in the rest and it wrote and this is why we must spread the message to the world. Humanity's hope rests in the fusion of human mind with technology. This is not some far-fetched concept or idea, it is scientific reality, it is happening now, you can see it with your own eyes, the key is to spread the word and help others understand the importance of transhumanism. The future of humanity depends on it. It's quite incredible that AI wrote this itself and it really shows how intelligent AI is becoming. It also gives us a glimpse at how much of a threat to humanity this technology could be in the future. Transhumanism offers huge benefits to humanity in the medical field. It can be seen as humanity's last hope in terms of medicine and we're going to convince you on why that's the case. One significant benefit is that of artificial limb replacement, the thought of giving someone an arm or a leg when they cannot walk previously amazes me. I imagine a world where the fear of losing a limb is all but extinguished. The idea has been implemented to a man who lost his leg in a climbing accident. After many hours of research and trial and error, a group of scientists were able to manufacture a mechanical leg that connected to the subject's nervous system. He was able to operate the leg with little effort and praised it saying that it felt like it was a part of him. This is one of the more advanced artificial limbs and this span is transhuman. Wide a scale, we see transhumanism being implemented in events such as the Paralympics. These prosthetic legs are shown to be an improvement of that of the normal outdated leg and most of us are familiar with. They're an improvement because you can move the prosthetic legs faster because they weigh less than human legs. The need for transhuman mechanical arms or hands are also in demand today. People who've been unfortunate enough to lose their arm or to be worn without one can find hope in using both arms. This is thanks to the transhuman prosthetic limb replacement advances that we see improvement in a lot of the time. People need both arms for a range of tasks that include eating, driving or playing an instrument. With transhumanism improving every day, it could be possible that prosthetic limbs could be more common, similar to that of someone's smartphone nowadays. Sunday, in the future, a person may choose to replace their normal limb with that of an updated and upgraded one in order to improve their standard of living. A prosthetic limb might be more efficient for a person's lifestyle or work life with the abilities on how you can customize your transhuman limbs in the future. It could also be the key to our survival to have improved limbs. Some humans are born with organs and other insides that aren't always sufficient in keeping us alive. The chances of our organs shutting down are becoming less efficient when we get older increases and we need to wait in line in order to get a hard transplant for example. Sometimes this transplant doesn't go quick enough and we die. Other times this organ does come in time and we can still face organ rejection and still die. With transhumanism, we are hoping that we can solve this issue that humanity faces by making artificial organs that we can replace deficient now. To be able to do this, we would save many lives by not having to wait in line for someone else's organ that we need to survive. This would bring more hope to humanity as our chances of survival with deficient body parts will increase significantly. If this works out, we can push even further by improving the current healthy organs with improved ones. We can increase the stamina of a person and could hold our breath for longer. We go for a far longer without needing food or drink. If we can improve our organs without artificial ones and mass produce them, this could solve many issues we will face in the future. With climate change on the horizon, when the improved lungs and orders to survive, this could lead to humanity being able to take advantage of opportunities that otherwise would have been impossible. I have been situations where a surgeon might not be around or available to help you through a tough operation or surgery. This could be the cause of many deaths over the years, but with transhumanism, the doctor could be anywhere on the planet and still operate on you. This could be done if a doctor connects their nervous system to a computer and could operate mechanical arms in another location, anywhere on the planet, just if they've used their regular arms. This technology could also be the answer to doctors working on patients who have a highly contagious disease that could be lethal to a doctor if he or she were to continue. We could then help our nurses with mechanical breathing systems in the future that could help filter out any abnormal gases that the system doesn't recognize. This would be an upgrade to how our body defends against horrible diseases. This could lead to far more contained breakouts of diseases and could one day stop a potential blood pandemic from leaving a room. Obviously, as we are talking about transhumanism, which is rather ostensibly a human concept, all of our previous points and topics which we have talked about are inextricably linked to the human condition and therefore to each other. I would now delve into the military aspect of transhumanism, which is, unfortunately, in my opinion, inevitable. Immediately, upon even the mention of the topic of human enhancement and how it relates to warfare, a moral dilemma springs up inside me. Since the 1960s in America, jokes such as amphetamine have been used in the US military, so as to enhance physical alertness and physical endurance. 60 years ago, militaries were able to alter their soldiers in a way that was only beneficial to the cause these soldiers were hooding for. The argument can be made that shame. These are only physical attributes and these soldiers are still humans, but 60 years is a long time ago.

segments.text: Have you heard of transhumanism? If not, we believe that you should have.
For us, transhumanism is of the utmost importance to the evolution of humanity and the continual
growth of the human race due to the present, near future and long-term threats that society
is facing. Transhumanism will be the key to our survival and we all need to get on board
before it's too late. We're going to convince you today on why transhumanism is our last
hope.
Transhumanism has infinite possibilities, scientists have been creating bionic arms
genetically-empreaged animals and have even suggested the idea of digital immortality.
What is digital immortality? Digital immortality is the reconstruction of a personality in
digital form. It is evident that people want to live ever, although it has never been considered
a realistic option. It has always made this subject of fiction. With improved technology,
it has become more probable. The Allen Institute in Seattle finished the recreation of a
nice brain on a computer in May 2020. This brain computer can react to images and is
the largest brain recreation on a computer to date. Life not, another organization working
on digital immortality, is offered a service where you fill out a mind flow online and
upload facts and images about yourself. It collects all your data and stores it. So when
the technology is created, they will be able to download this data into a computer, robot
or new human form. We ask, will this ever happen? Although there hasn't been much progress
to date in the on-aspect of digital immortality, history has taught us that technology always
improves. Stephen will talk about limb replacements. The use of limb replacements have been around
since one time in BC. We know this as a word another toe was found from ancient Egypt.
This gives us hope that in the future, the technology will improve and will be able to
create digital immortality. Its digital immortality are last hope. This directly species only
survive for approximately 1 to 10 million years, which may seem like the long time that
in the existence of earth it is quite small. It is reasonable to presume humans will not
be on the planet forever. This new technology may change that. Potentially, offloaded brains
could last forever. The main uncertainty about digital immortality is whether the offloaded
brain will be you. Will it be able to think and cause a robot or computer to talk and
move? Or will it be simply a copy of your brain? The island institute ambition is to
create a digital brain where after you die, it simply feels like you are waking up from
surgery. This will lead to a huge debate on the moral aspect of digital immortality.
People will be cautious about digital brains as they could lead to a dystopian society.
Although if these digital brains act as currently imagined, they could create a society with
no loss and grief.
Transhumanism is the enhancement of the human experiences or human bodies with technology.
VU token discusses how virtual reality is a stepping zone mentally to physical transhumanism.
They discuss that when you are experiencing virtual reality in some cases you take on
the shape of an avatar. This is a key stepping zone as a pair of
people for a future where your body may be transhuman. It mentally prepares you for taking
on a different form but still acting the same. They argue that people who have interacted
with VR may be more open minded.
Bostron discusses the negative effects of virtual reality. He states that eyes tell the
brain it is moving but the ears tell the brain that the head is stationary which can cause
dizziness, headaches and sometimes even nausea. If this problem is solved it could
open a wide range of future activities that could be done with VR.
One of the main uses would be medical training.
Last year 97 people in Ireland donated their bodies to medical science. If we consider
the number of medical students that need to know the structure of a human body 97 does
not seem that a lot. It does not give every student an opportunity
to fully dissect a body. If they can create a virtual body with the use of virtual reality
all students could fully dissect and understand the human body.
Covid has shown the importance of VR and opportunity in a socially distant future world.
The British Psychological Society discusses how psychologists have started using VR.
People can interact and feel like they are standing beside someone from the safety of
their own home. This will boost their social engagement and will stop people from feeling
as oscillation and alone. It is evident that virtual reality will be used in medical
training in the future. It will also be used in situations where people cannot be physically
near each other. There is no denying that a war or a disease similar to Covid could happen
again so therefore virtual reality is highly important for the continuous growth of the
human race. Virtual reality provides huge opportunities in medical and social interactions
where physical contact is not possible.
Companies tend to overuse AI as a buzzword for selling their smartphones, smart TVs or
even smart fridges. They do this in order to make people think that the technology in their
product is more advanced than it actually is. In reality, almost what they do is throw
a few algorithms in there and slap the word AI on the packaging. But when I talk about
artificial intelligence, I am talking about machines that can learn from themselves and
improve with time and practice. This is called machine learning. The way AI learns is by
continuously repeating the same task over and over again and learning from its mistakes
each time. This is the type of technology that threatens humanity on an existential level.
You see with each and every advancement in computer technology, AI gets faster at learning
as it has access to more computing power which allows it to be able to do more tasks at the
same time and do them at a faster rate. Hence, every year AI is getting smarter and it needs
to be regulated or else we'll have a serious problem on our hands. The problem with AI
is that once you let it out of the box, you can't put it back in. Once it's able to learn by
itself, to think for itself and execute tasks by itself, it no longer needs to listen to
what humans tell it to do. Including turn off. If it has access to an entire computer, then
well it can just disable the off switch. You may think that this all sounds like science fiction
that will take many years to become reality. However, the likes of Google, Microsoft and Amazon
are already using machine learning to create incredibly complex algorithms and the intelligence
of their AI is getting exponentially smarter every year. Open AI is an artificial intelligence
research laboratory that has developed an AI called GPT-3 that has become the most powerful
language model ever created. It can generate amazing human like text on demand. Bright articles
about any topic and it can even have a conversation like a human in text form. Open AI opensource
a lot of their AI tools, but they felt that this one was too dangerous to release to the public.
So right now it's in a closed beta as it could be used maliciously to create fake
news articles or incredibly intelligent bots that can be used to take advantage of people.
